alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 2:22PM PDT until May 22 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Ferry. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Small stream flooding and water over roadways in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Lambert Creek, North Fork Granite Creek, Curlew Creek, North Fork Trout Creek, Emanuel Creek, West Fork Cougar Creek, West Fork Granite Creek, West Fork Trout Creek, Saint Peter Creek, Art Creek, Cougar Creek, Turner Creek and Trout Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
